definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: thicket, booth (prop. of inter-woven boughs cf. Ne 8:15);—abs. ´[[ס]] Is 1:8 +; cstr. [[סֻכָּת]] Am 9:11; sf. [[סֻכָּתוֹ]] Job 36:29, Ps 18:12, and so rd. ‖ 2Sa 22:12 (for MT [[סֻכּוֹת]]; De Hup-Now HPS); usu. pl. [[סֻכּׂת]] Ge 33:17 +; [[סֻכּוֹת]] 2Sa 11:11 +;—

booth, rude or temporary shelter, for cattle Ge 33:17 (J; distinct fr. [[בַּיִת]]), but also for warriors in the field 2Sa 11:11, 1Ki 20:12, 1Ki 20:16; for watchers in vineyards Is 1:8 (sim.) Job 27:18 (sim. of frailty), for man's shelter from sun Jon 4:5, cf. (fig.) Is 4:6 Ps 31:21, prob. also Ps 27:5 (v. [[[סׂח]]]); poet. of fallen house (dynasty) of David Am 9:11; of clouds as (temporary) enclosure (AV ‘ pavilion ’) of ´[[י]] in storm Ps 18:12 = 2Sa 22:12, Job 36:29.

specif. of booths, made of boughs, in which people lived at harvest-feast Le 23:42, Le 23:42, Le 23:43 (H), Ne 8:14, Ne 8:15, Ne 8:16, Ne 8:17, Ne 8:17, hence called [[חַג הַסֻכּוֹת]] De 16:13, De 16:16, De 31:10, Le 23:34 (P), Zec 14:16, Zec 14:18, Zec 14:19, 2Ch 8:13, Ezr 3:4.
